Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.audio

Class Listener

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.audio.Listener
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.audio.Listener
public final class Listener extends org.jsfml.audio.Listener
Represents the point in the scene from where all the sounds are heard and provides funcionality to modify it. Modifying the position and orientation ("view direction") of the listener changes the way sounds are heard to accomplish 3D sound. Sounds will be panned and attenuated according to their position relative to the listener and the listener's orientation.

  • Method Details

    • getGlobalVolume

      public static float getGlobalVolume()
      Gets the global sound volume.
      Returns:
      the global sound volume, ranging between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume)

    • setGlobalVolume

      public static void setGlobalVolume(float volume)
      Sets the global sound volume. The default global volume is 100 (maximum).
      Parameters:
      volume - the global sound volume, ranging between 0 (silence) and 100 (full volume)

    • getPosition

      public static Vector3f getPosition()
      Gets the listener's current position in the scene.
      Returns:
      the listener's current position in the scene

    • setPosition

      public static void setPosition(@NotNull @NotNull Vector3f position)
      Sets the position of the listener in the scene. Initially, the listener is located at the origin (0, 0, 0).
      Parameters:
      position - the listener's new position
      See Also:
      • SoundSource.setPosition(Vector3f)

    • setPosition

      public static void setPosition(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the position of the listener in the scene. Initially, the listener is located at the origin (0, 0, 0).
      Parameters:
      x - the X coordinate of the listener's new position
      y - the Y coordinate of the listener's new position
      z - the Z coordinate of the listener's new position
      See Also:
      • SoundSource.setPosition(Vector3f)

    • getDirection

      public static Vector3f getDirection()
      Gets the listener's current orientation or "view direction" in the scene.
      Returns:
      the listener's current orientation in the scene

    • setDirection

      public static void setDirection(@NotNull @NotNull Vector3f direction)
      Sets the orientation or "view direction" of the listener in the scene.

      The vector passed does not need to be normalized. Initially, the listener's orientation is along the Z axis, looking "into" the screen (0, 0, -1).

      Parameters:
      direction - the listener's new orientation.
      See Also:
      • SoundSource.setPosition(Vector3f)

    • setDirection

      public static void setDirection(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the orientation or "view direction" of the listener in the scene. The vector passed does not need to be normalized. Initially, the listener's orientation is along the Z axis, looking "into" the screen (0, 0, -1).
      Parameters:
      x - the X component of the listener's new orientation
      y - the Y component of the listener's new orientation
      z - the Z component of the listener's new orientation
      See Also:
      • SoundSource.setPosition(Vector3f)
